medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced knee pain for at least 30 years, dating the onset of his left knee problems to a soccer injury at age 26. Initially, pain diminished over time, but it recurred about 15 years ago and became severe, leading him to stop running. He has had several courses of physical therapy. Pain worsens after standing for long periods and when bending the left knee.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior diagnosis of ruptured ligaments from the soccer injury at age 26, underwent arthroscopic debridement 13 years ago; otherwise, no other medical problems or surgeries.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in Boston with his wife and owns a business. Maintains an active lifestyle as an ultra-marathon cyclist, cycles about 7000 miles annually, follows a vegetarian diet, and does not smoke or drink.
